channel.title: microsoft.data.analysis on Fred Wieser
channel.description: Recent content in microsoft.data.analysis on Fred Wieser

item.title: dataframerow
item.description: DataFrameRow Object –> DataFrameRow A collection of values that represent a row in a DataFrame. Properties Item(index) - Returns the value at index. Methods GetEnumerator() - Returns an enumerator of the values in this row.

item.title: dataframecolumn
item.description: DataFrameColumn Object –> DataFrameColumn A collection of values that represent a column in a DataFrame. Properties DataType - The type of data this column holds. Item(length, startIndex) - Returns length number of values starting from startIndex. Item(rowIndex) - Get/set values at rowIndex. Length - The length of this column. Name - The name of this column. NullCount - The number of null values in this column. Methods AddDataViewColumn AddValueUsingCursor All - Boolean if all the elements are True.

item.title: dataframe
item.description: DataFrame Object –> DataFrame A data structure to support indexing, binary operations, sorting, selecting, and other APIs. dotnet add package Microsoft.Data.Analysis Accessing Elements // Access the element at row, col: df[row, col] // or df.Rows[row, col] Rows // Access the nth row: df.Rows[n] Columns // Access a column by name: df["column_name"] // Access the nth column: df.Columns[n] DataFrame // Filter the DataFrame: df.Filter(df.Columns["column"].ElementwiseGreaterThan(50)) // All rows in column with values > 50.
